{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3156051,"name":"L","username":"llthehackr","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/l/2acd7d/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-02T18:24:02.667Z","cooked":"

Hello,

Our team has been experiencing an issue lately with shuffleboard. Whenever going into test mode, after a few seconds, we would see a continuous stream of messages saying “Failed to update publishers” mixed with “Failed to update subscribers”, then after about a minute, the JVM would crash with an out of memory error. We checked the shuffleboard ungrouped section, and there were around 400 PIDController widgets there. Is this possibly a bug with WPILib, or did we do something different. If it helps, we are using WPILib version 2023.3.2 and create 5 PIDController objects before going into test mode.

Any feedback would be appreciated, Thanks!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2023-03-02T18:24:02.667Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":180,"reads":90,"readers_count":89,"score":918.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":428691,"topic_slug":"too-many-pidcontroller-widgets-appearing-on-shuffleboard-in-livewindow","display_username":"L","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56515,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/too-many-pidcontroller-widgets-appearing-on-shuffleboard-in-livewindow/428691/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3156054,"name":null,"username":"Starlight220","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/starlight220/{size}/150872_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-02T18:27:02.735Z","cooked":"

Can you send the error with stacktrace/log and a link to your code?

The link to our code: https://github.com/WiredCatsRobotics2415/WiredCats2023

I do not have a stacktrace from running the code on an actual roboRIO, though I do remember it giving an OOM error. I was able to run it in the simulator, though, and got a similar output (The abort at the end is when, I assume, my OS killed it because it was using too much memory):

The repository is private.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2023-03-02T18:57:08.661Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":77,"readers_count":76,"score":25.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":428691,"topic_slug":"too-many-pidcontroller-widgets-appearing-on-shuffleboard-in-livewindow","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":56515,"username":"llthehackr","name":"L","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/l/2acd7d/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":45763,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6738a | ISR | WPILib"},"post_url":"/t/too-many-pidcontroller-widgets-appearing-on-shuffleboard-in-livewindow/428691/4","custom_user_title":"6738a | ISR | WPILib","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3156122,"name":"L","username":"llthehackr","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/l/2acd7d/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-02T20:08:26.502Z","cooked":"

It is public now, and will be as long as this issue is unresolved. Thank you.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2023-03-02T20:08:26.502Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":67,"readers_count":66,"score":28.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":428691,"topic_slug":"too-many-pidcontroller-widgets-appearing-on-shuffleboard-in-livewindow","display_username":"L","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":45763,"username":"Starlight220","name":null,"avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/starlight220/{size}/150872_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56515,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/too-many-pidcontroller-widgets-appearing-on-shuffleboard-in-livewindow/428691/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3156134,"name":null,"username":"Starlight220","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/starlight220/{size}/150872_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-02T20:27:21.451Z","cooked":"

You’re creating a PIDController in testPeriodic() (every 20 ms). Don’t do that – if dynamic gains are needed, have one object and mutate it. Allocating them in loops overwhelms the GC and the LiveWindow/NetworkTables stuff.
How long after enabling test mode does the crash happen?

That was our issue. Instead of re-creating a PIDController object every time test periodic ran, we just used setP and setD. Thanks!
